intro: Gymnogramma elongata var. itatiaiensis, commonly known as the Itatiaia spleenwort, is a fern species native to South America. It belongs to the family Pteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the undersides of the leaves. This variant is distinguished by its elongated leaves and is often found in humid tropical regions.
